name: Zyzzyva Search
summary: Learn about .ZZS files and view a list of programs that open them.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download

content: Scrabble players (and other wordsmiths) use Zyzzyva to look up, study, and quiz themselves on words. In Zyzzyva's Search mode, users can create and execute word searches that include a variety of conditions. For example, a user can create a search that returns only words that have between two and six anagrams.

If a user plans to review to a search's results regularly, or they want to use the search to create a Zyzzyva quiz (.ZZQ file), they can save that search as a ZZS file (by selecting Save Search... in the Search window). Each ZZS file contains all that search's conditions, written in a plain text, XML format.

description: A ZZS file is a search query created for use with NASPA Zyzzyva, a word study program. It contains one or more search conditions written in XML format. Zyzzyva users can use ZZS files to conduct word searches or create word quizzes.

instructions: You can open a ZZS file in NASPA Zyzzyva (multiplatform), to run the search it contains. To do so:
Select File â†’ Search from Zyzzyva's menu bar.
Navigate to and open your ZZS file.
You can also open a ZZS file in Microsoft Notepad (Windows), Apple TextEdit (Mac), or any other text editor, to view the XML data it contains.
